SEARCH
Package librarySE.managers.reports

Class ActivityReportService

java.lang.Object
librarySE.managers.reports.ActivityReportService
public class ActivityReportService extends Object
Service class that provides analytical reporting features for library activity.

ActivityReportService processes historical BorrowRecord data to compute high-level insights about how the library is being used, such as:

  • Which users borrow the most items (top borrowers).
  • Which materials (books, CDs, journals) are borrowed most frequently.
  • Which items are overdue for a specific user at a given reference date.

Thread-Safety and Data Model

Internally, the service stores a snapshot of borrow records in a CopyOnWriteArrayList, which provides:

  • Safe iteration while other threads may read concurrently.
  • Stable, snapshot-like behavior for reporting scenarios.

The service is designed to be primarily read-heavy. For most use cases, a new instance can be constructed whenever a fresh view of the data is needed. Alternatively, the underlying list can be extended externally before passing it into this service.

Typical Usage


 List<BorrowRecord> history = borrowManager.getAllBorrowRecords();
 ActivityReportService reports = new ActivityReportService(history);

 Map<User, Long> topBorrowers = reports.getTopBorrowers();
 Map<String, Long> popularItems = reports.getMostBorrowedItems();
 List<BorrowRecord> overdueForUser =
         reports.getOverdueItemsForUser(someUser, LocalDate.now());

This class focuses on aggregation and analytics only; it does not modify the underlying BorrowRecord instances.

Author:
Malak

  • Constructor Details

    • ActivityReportService

      public ActivityReportService(List<BorrowRecord> borrowRecords)
      Creates a new ActivityReportService with a given list of borrow records.

      The provided collection is copied into an internal CopyOnWriteArrayList to allow safe concurrent reads and iteration during aggregation.

      Parameters:
      borrowRecords - list of borrow records to analyze (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if borrowRecords is null

  • Method Details

    • getTopBorrowers

      public Map<User,Long> getTopBorrowers()
      Computes how many items each user has borrowed in total.

      The result groups all borrow records by User and counts how many records belong to each. This effectively answers the question: "How many borrowing events has each user performed?"

      Returns:
      a map where:
      • keys are users
      • values are the total number of items they have borrowed

    • getMostBorrowedItems

      public Map<String,Long> getMostBorrowedItems()
      Determines which library items were borrowed the most.

      Items are aggregated by a human-readable label in the format: 

       "Title (TYPE)"

      Example: "Clean Code (BOOK)". This allows multiple copies of the same logical item to be counted together, regardless of internal identifiers.

      Returns:
      a map where:
      • keys are item labels such as "Title (TYPE)"
      • values are the number of times those items were borrowed

    • getOverdueItemsForUser

      public List<BorrowRecord> getOverdueItemsForUser(User user, LocalDate date)
      Returns all overdue borrow records for a given user at a specific date.

      A record is considered overdue if:

      • its associated User equals the given user, and
      • BorrowRecord.isOverdue(LocalDate) returns true for the given date

      Common usages include:

      • Admin overdue and fine reports.
      • Sending reminder emails or notifications for late returns.
      Parameters:
      user - the user whose overdue items should be checked (must not be null)
      date - the reference date to compare against due dates (must not be null)
      Returns:
      list of overdue borrow records for that user at the given date
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if user or date is null
